Job Title: Apprenticeship Training Program Manager

Location: Wilson, NC

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
At Watson Electrical we believe in the importance of delivering not only power, but also the confidence and peace of mind that comes from a job well done. Every Watson job must meet our high-performance standards for quality workmanship and compliance. All the while, maintaining strict controls over cost and schedule.

Skilled in large-scale construction services, we help meet the needs of commercial, industrial, mission-critical, and other industries. From pre-construction to maintenance, our commercial construction services are designed for performance and quality. Incorporating technology into our construction process increases productivity while reducing costs.

Summary

In this high visible position, you will oversee the administration of the apprenticeship program – curriculum, grades, instructors. Started in 1952, it is the premiere electrical training program in the state. Our apprentices have won numerous state and national competitions. Prestige and bragging rights.

We value our Veterans. We actively recruit veterans and exiting military members in support of our men and women who served in the military. As we are an approved Veteran Administration training facility, you will be the key in ensuring our Veteran employees receive their hard-earned benefits.

Manage LMS – we launched a Learning Management System in 2018. This system is the backbone of our training. As we grow the university, the LMS is a critical piece to tracking, assigning and record keeping of our training.

You will be our main POC to Coordinate with appropriate gov’t agencies – DOL, VA

Compensation

Salary: Based on Experience

Qualifications

Three or more years’ experience in program management, with a focus on education and trainingExperience working within or in partnership with a college or corporate university highly desiredAbility to learn and navigate new software (LMS and Apprentice software)Proficiency in MS Suite of ApplicationsWorking knowledge of Apprenticeship requirements is a plusA teaching degree also a plusAttention to detail is a plusHigh School graduate or equivalent GED.

Essential Functions

The essential functions of the position include but are not limited to the following:

Manage the delivery of related supplemental instruction for apprenticeship programs across Watson Electrical ensuring our apprentice program is delivered in accordance to State and NCCER standards, policies and procedures, contracted obligations and within funding budgetsCoordinate facilities and related equipment for apprenticeship programsCoordinate logistics to include scheduling, catering, and hotel reservations around the company Master Training scheduleDevelop and maintain necessary Memorandums of Understanding (MOU) with partnersTrack and maintain asset inventory to include equipment (supplies, tools, and materials)Map out the company master training schedule each year, communicating starts to all participants and appropriate leadership staff.Coordinate with the Regional Training Supervisors to hire instructors, and managing scheduling changes semester to semesterSchedule and create classes with NCCER registry for each semester, populate semester class rosters, build Apprentice database, collect all required forms for each location for apprentice registration for each semester start, confirm registration of apprenticesCommunicate information with apprentices about semester class enrollment and schedulingTroubleshoot student performance issues, breaks in apprenticeship training, supporting struggling apprentices to continue with the programCoordinate delivery of textbooks and other instructional material to instructors and apprenticesFile all program documentation as required (manually and electronically)Manage, Plan, and coordinate Annual Watson Electrical, State, and National Apprentice competitionsResponsible for maintaining records in accordance with NCCER requirements

Watson Electrical in an equal opportunity employer.

Experience Level (if available): Internship
